p: Based on this background, food fortification might be the best option to increase the vitamin D supply to the population compared with vitamin D supplementation (e.g., pharmaceutical pills) [ 90]. Fortification, including biofortification (increase the natural content of vitamin D in food), of a wider range of foods, which accommodate diversity, is likely to have the potential to increase vitamin D intakes across population groups and consequently minimize the prevalence of vitamin D deficiency. Vitamin D-biofortified eggs are a good example of one of these novel food-based solutions, which together with other vitamin D-containing foods, can play a role in tackling low vitamin D intakes [ 69, 74, 79, 80].
